title: Questions, Likes, and Negatives
objectives: Say you don't do something using 안/못
context: Two small words open up conversation: 좋아하다 (to like) and -고 싶다 (to want).
안 and 못 sit before verbs to make simple negatives. 안 = don't, 못 = can't (unable).
Rising intonation turns statements into questions, or add -아요/어요? with a question mark.

vocabulary.english: Is it okay? / Are you okay?

sentences.english: I can't go today. Tomorrow works.
Do you need it? No, it's okay.

explanation: Add -아요/어요? with rising tone to ask yes/no questions. WH-words (뭐/언제/어디/누구/왜/어떻게) stay in place: 누구 좋아해요?
좋아하다 takes an object: 커피를 좋아해요. 'I like coffee.'
-고 싶어요 attaches to verb stems to express desire: 가고 싶어요 (I want to go), 배우고 싶어요 (I want to learn).
안 + verb = don't/won't (choice). 못 + verb = can't (ability/circumstance).
필요하다 means 'to need.' You can say 필요 없어요 = I don't need it.

messages.speaker: 지수
messages.korean: 안녕하세요! 오늘 점심에 한국 음식 먹어요?
messages.english: Hello! Are you eating Korean food for lunch today?
messages.romanization: annyeonghaseyo! oneul jeomsime hanguk eumsik meogeoyo?

messages.speaker: 민호
messages.korean: 죄송합니다. 저는 지금 못 먹어요. 식당 안 가요.
messages.english: I'm sorry. I can't eat now. I'm not going to the restaurant.
messages.romanization: joesonghamnida. jeoneun jigeum mot meogeoyo. sikdang an gayo.

messages.speaker: 지수
messages.english: Are you okay? Do you need water?

messages.speaker: 민호
messages.korean: 네, 물이 필요해요. 커피도 좋아해요. 커피 원해요.
messages.english: Yes, I need water. I like coffee too. I want coffee.
messages.romanization: ne, muri piryohaeyo. keopido joahaeyo. keopi wonhaeyo.

messages.speaker: 지수
messages.korean: 저는 커피 마시고 싶어요. 점심 시간 알고 싶어요.
messages.english: I want to drink coffee. I want to know the lunchtime.
messages.romanization: jeoneun keopi masigo sipeoyo. jeomsim sigan algo sipeoyo.

messages.speaker: 민호
messages.korean: 저도 점심 시간 알고 싶어요. 괜찮아요.
messages.english: I also want to know the lunchtime. It's okay.
messages.romanization: jeodo jeomsim sigan algo sipeoyo. gwaenchanayo.
